thread.title: Paraguayan footballer Julio Irrazabal unties opponent’s shoelace in hilarious prank during Deportivo Capiata vs Atletico Paranaense Copa Libertadores clash
thread.title_full: Paraguayan footballer Julio Irrazabal unties opponent’s shoelace in hilarious prank during Deportivo Capiata vs Atletico Paranaense Copa Libertadores clash

author: arichardson
title: Paraguayan footballer Julio Irrazabal unties opponent’s shoelace in hilarious prank during Deportivo Capiata vs Atletico Paranaense Copa Libertadores clash

organizations.name: tv times manchester united vs southampton

text:
Julio Irrazabal battles with an opponent during 1-0 home loss in Copa Libertadores 
And that is exactly why we salute Paraguayan defender, Julio Irrazabal. 
Keep up to date with ALL the football news, gossip and transfers 
Lining up to take a free-kick in last night’s Copa Libertadores clash for Deportivo Capiata against Brazilian side, Atletico Paranaense, the 36-year-old was initially blocked off. 
So, while pretending to place the ball in the perfect spot, he discreetly untied his opponent’s shoelaces. 
The unwitting Atletico man had his back to Irrazabal— we assume — to take orders about where to stand from his goalkeeper. 
And his face is a picture when he turned around to face the Deportivo defender and felt the cool air gushing through to the inside of his shoe. Fox Sports 2 Julio Irrazabal cheekily unties opponent’s shoelace in Copa Libertadores clash Related Stories in the hat When is the Europa League last 16 draw? Manchester United through and Tottenham hope to join them - all you need to know PREM FIXTURES Chelsea look to extend lead at the top of the table to 11 points against Swansea Guns Firing blanks Koscielny admits Arsenal have a 'mental problem' when facing big teams like Bayern Munich That's not on Why aren't Arsenal playing this weekend? Arsene Wenger's team given extra time off - here's why TV Times Manchester United vs Southampton: What TV channel is the EFL Cup final on and when is it? Getty Images Lucho Gonzalez celebrates after his winner sent Atletico Paranense through 
It’s simple, but so satisfyingly good. 
Well done, Julio. 
Aside from that moment of genius, it wasn’t such a good night for him. AP:Associated Press 4 Julio Irrazabal’s side may have lost the match, but is he not the biggest winner? 
Former Porto and Marseille midfielder, Lucho Gonzalez, scored the only goal of the night to give Atletico a 1-0 win. 
And, following a 3-3 draw in Paraguay in the first leg, it means the Brazilian side advance to the group stage. 
But Irrazabal managed to subtly untie an opponent’s shoelace, so who’s the real winner?
